resources.string: In this guide you’ll find all the necessary and up to date information on the best places to visit in the city.
It runs from Edinburgh Castle to the Palace of Holyrood…
It stands high on the Castle Rock, overlooking all the city…
Calton Hill offers stunning panoramic views of Edinburgh…
It is the Queen’s official residence in Scotland…
It was built on an old sanctuary dating from the ninth century…
This Skye Terrier guarded over his owner\'s grave for 14 years…
It is a true marvel of urban planning and elegant Neo-Classical architecture…
Victoria Street has to be one of the most photographed locations in the city…
This area is one of the most vibrant, picturesque and lively areas of the city…
A busy street lined with shops, historic monuments and restaurants…
It reveals Scotland’s culture and history up to the present day…
You can discover the history of the city of Edinburgh…
It features several collections of art from the Renaissance to the Post-Impressionism…
Toys, playthings, doll houses and games from several periods…
Explores the history of medicine and the development of surgery and dentistry…
It features modern and contemporary art work…
It explores the history of Scotland through the portraits…
It commemorates the life and work of three of the most important Scottish writers…
It is the most important public park in the heart of Edinburgh…
It is a pleasant village located on the Water of Leith…
It is made up of over 70 acres of grounds…
It is the largest green space in Edinburgh with 650 acres…
Water of Leith Walkway is a 15 km footpath that runs besides the Water of Leith…
It is one of the city\'s most popular green spaces…
It is an extinct volcano which is the main peak of the group of hills in Edinburgh…
A few miles from Edinburgh city centre, is a charming seaside suburb, with two miles of sand…
It is an award-winning contemporary sculpture garden located just outside Edinburgh…
It shows its visitors the making process of whisky…
It is one of Edinburgh’s oldest and most famous closes…
It has a feast of fresh produce and artisan bakers and cheese…
It has interactive exhibitions full of optical illusions, a mirror maze, a tunnel, etc…
It offers its visitors the chance to take a journey to discover all the aspects of the Earth…
